int IMPORT libInject::CreateHook ( void *  Destination,
void *  CallBack,
bool  WantRegisterAccess = false,
size_t  ParamCount = 0 
)

Places a function hook.

Attention:
Callbacks with parameters must always be declared as follows:
  • with stdcall calling convention
  • the parameters must be declared as references

Before the callback's execution, the following operations are performed:
  • The registers EAX, ECX, EDX, EBX, ESP, EBP, ESI, EDI will be saved
  • The parameters of the hooked function are put as references onto the stack
  • The register EAX gets overwritten with the callback address

After the callback's execution, the following operations are performed:
  • The registers EAX, ECX, EDX, EBX, ESP, EBP, ESI, EDI will be recovered
Parameters:
Destination The function to be hooked.
CallBack The callback function.
WantRegisterAccess Gives access to the saved registers over a sRegs-struct.
ParamCount The target function's parameter count.
Returns:
a operation handle.

Sample: 

           int sampleclass::samplefunc(char* text, int& a, int b)
           {
               //does something...
           };

           static __stdcall void foo::cbfunc(char** text, int** a, int& b)
           {
           };

           void foo()
           {
               CreateHook(&samplefunc, &cbfunc, false, 3);
           };

Sample (with register access): 

           int sampleclass::samplefunc(char* text, int& a, int b)
           {
               //does something...
           };

           static __stdcall void foo::cbfunc(csRegs& Register, char** text, int** a, int& b)
           {
               static foo MyClass;
               //Makes this to MyClass
               Register.ECX = &MyClass;
           };

           void foo()
           {
               CreateHook(&samplefunc, &cbfunc, true, 3);
           };
int IMPORT libInject::ConditionalHook_C ( void *  Destination,
void *  CallBack,
void *  ConditionVar,
bool  WantRegisterAccess = false,
size_t  ParamCount = 0 
)

Places a conditional function hook.

Remarks:
The callback function is called only, if the following condition is fulfilled:
  • Caller == ConditionVar
Attention:
Look at this.
Parameters:
Destination The function to be hooked.
CallBack The callback function.
ConditionVar The calling condition value.
WantRegisterAccess Gives access to the saved registers over a sRegs-struct.
ParamCount The target function's parameter count.
Returns:
a operation handle.

Sample: 

           int sampleclass::samplefunc(char* text, int& a, int b)
           {
               //does something...
           };

           void sampleclass::caller()
           {
               int a = 1;
               this->samplefunc("test", a, 0);
           };

           static __stdcall void foo::cbfunc(char** text, int** a, int& b)
           {
           };

           void foo()
           {
               ConditionalHook_C(&samplefunc, &cbfunc, &caller, false, 3);
           };
See also:
CreateHook, ConditionalHook_C_N
int IMPORT libInject::ConditionalHook_C_N ( void *  Destination,
void *  CallBack,
void *  ConditionVar,
bool  WantRegisterAccess = false,
size_t  ParamCount = 0 
)

Places a conditional function hook.

Remarks:
Same as ConditionalHook_C, with the following condition:
  • Caller != ConditionVar
See also:
CreateHook, ConditionalHook_C
int IMPORT libInject::ConditionalHook_R ( void *  Destination,
void *  CallBack,
eRegs  Register,
int  ConditionVar,
bool  WantRegisterAccess = false,
size_t  ParamCount = 0 
)

Places a conditional function hook.

Remarks:
The callback function is called only, if the following condition is fulfilled:
  • Register == ConditionVar
Attention:
Look at this.
Parameters:
Destination The function to be hooked.
CallBack The callback function.
Register The register to compare with.
ConditionVar The calling condition value.
WantRegisterAccess Gives access to the saved registers over a sRegs-struct.
ParamCount The target function's parameter count.
Returns:
a operation handle.

Sample (Register ECX): 

           int sampleclass::samplefunc(char* text, int& a, int b)
           {
               //does something...
           };

           static __stdcall void foo::cbfunc(char** text, int** a, int& b)
           {
           };

           void foo()
           {
               sampleclass* bar = new sampleclass;
               ConditionalHook_R(&samplefunc, &cbfunc, ER_ECX, bar, false, 3);
               bar->samplefunc("test", a, 0);
           };
See also:
CreateHook
int IMPORT libInject::ReplaceFunction ( void *  Destination,
void *  NewFunc 
)

Replaces a function by your own.

Attention:
The function to replace with must be declared just like the original function.
Parameters:
Destination The function to replace.
NewFunc The function to replace with.
Returns:
a operation handle.

Sample: 

           int __cdecl sampleclass::samplefunc(char* text, int& a, int b)
           {
               //does something...
           };

           static __cdecl int foo::NewFunc(char* text, int& a, int b)
           {
               //does something else...
           };

           void foo()
           {
               ReplaceFunction(&samplefunc, &NewFunc);
           };
int IMPORT libInject::RedirectCall ( void *  Destination,
void *  NewFunc 
)

Redirects a function call.

Attention:
The function to replace with must be declared just like the original function.
Parameters:
Destination The call to redirect.
NewFunc The function to redirect to.
Returns:
a operation handle.

Sample: 

           int __cdecl sampleclass::samplefunc(char* text, int& a, int b)
           {
               //does something...
           };

           static __cdecl int foo::NewFunc(char* text, int& a, int b)
           {
               //does something else...
           };

           // some assembler code
           0x452475    inc edx
           0x452476    call 0x402416 (sampleclass::samplefunc)

           void foo()
           {
               RedirectCall( (void*)0x452476, &NewFunc );
           };

Performs a operation rollback.

Parameters:
hOperation A handle to the operation to undo.
